Transient Navier Stokes Flow

This class solves the transient Navier Stokes problem.

Strong formulation

Momentum equation

\[\rho \frac{\partial \vec{u}}{\partial t} + \rho \vec{u} \cdot \nabla \vec{u} = \nabla \cdot \boldsymbol{\sigma} + \vec{b}\]

Continuity

\[\nabla \cdot \vec{u} = 0\]

where \(\vec{u}\) and p are the velocity and pressure field respectively with the constants \(\rho\) and \(\mu\) are the fluid density and dynamic viscosity respectively.

Boundary conditions

Fixed value boundary condition

\[\vec{u} = \vec{u}_D \;\forall \vec{x} \in \Gamma_D\]

Traction boundary condition

\[\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \hat{\textbf{n}} = \vec{t} \;\;\forall \vec{x} \in \Gamma_N\]

Weak formulation

In this implementation, we the mid-point method for time integration. Let \(\mathcal{L}(u, p)\) be the weak formulation obtained in the steady state Navier Stokes, the weak formulation for the transient problem is

\[0 = \left( \vec{w}, \frac{\vec{u}^n - \vec{u}^{n-1}}{\Delta t} \right) + \theta\mathcal{L}(\vec{u}^n, p^n) + (1-\theta)\mathcal{L}(\vec{u}^0, p^n)\]

Stabilization parameters

Stabilization parameter now has time dependence and is defined as

\[\begin{split}\tau = \left( \left( \frac{1}{\Delta t} \right)^2 + \left(\frac{2|\vec{u}|}{h}\right)^2 + 9\left(\frac{4\nu}{h^2}\right)^2 \right)^{-0.5} \\\end{split}\]

In this case, we use the same stabilization parameter for both SUPG and PSPG

Class definition

class flatiron_tk.physics.IncompressibleNavierStokes(mesh)
add_stab()
build_function_space()

Build the function space and set member Test/Trial/Solution functions

set_initial_conditions(u, p)
set_mid_point_theta(new_theta)
set_time_step_size(dt)
set_weak_form(stab=False)

The weak form here is the sum of all of the weak forms from every physics
